alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Butte, Blackfoot Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued September 20 at 1:52PM MDT until September 21 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 PM MDT THURSDAY ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow expected above 6500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. Above 7500 feet 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph over the Divide. * WHERE...Bitterroot Mountains including Lost Trail Pass, Anaconda Range, Flint Creek Range, and Boulder Mountains. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Backcountry travel could be affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The more intense showers could drive snow levels down below 6500 feet.
info.instruction: Outdoor recreationalists should be prepared for winter conditions. Snowfall could impact roads and cold temperatures may result in hypothermia.

area.areaDesc: Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Butte, Blackfoot Region
